intro: Rudbeckia fulgida var. fulgida, commonly known as the "Firewheel" or "Garden Globemallow," is a perennial flowering plant native to eastern North America. It features showy, bright yellow ray flowers surrounding a central disk of dark brown to black florets, creating a striking visual effect. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 feet, with lance-shaped, dark green leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes. Its botanical characteristics include a robust root system and a tendency to form clumps, which can be divided for propagation.
